thread.title: LIer Kevin O'Connell wins first Oscar after 21 nominations, for 'Hacksaw Ridge'
thread.title_full: LIer Kevin O'Connell wins first Oscar after 21 nominations, for 'Hacksaw Ridge' | Newsday

author: The Associated Press
title: LIer Kevin O'Connell wins first Oscar after 21 nominations, for 'Hacksaw Ridge'
text:
Long Island native Kevin O'Connell is finally an Oscar winner.
On his 21st nomination, the 59-year-old sound re-recording engineer has won for sound mixing on "Hacksaw Ridge."
Most popular Bill Paxton dies at 61, family rep says Who should (and will) win at this yearâ€™s Oscars Oscar winner Viola Davis gives tearful speech on 'Fences' LI's Portman missing Oscars due to pregnancy Celebs launch pot brands as California legalizes drug Until Sunday he had owned the record for most nominations without a win, having set that mark in 2008 with his 18th nomination and loss.
He shared the trophy with three others for their work on the Mel Gibson-directed movie.
A giddy O'Connell, who was born on Long Island in 1957, clutched his gold statue and told the audience he couldn't even express how much it meant to him.
Movies Follow Oscar winners and highlights He explained that his late mother got him a job in sound mixing 39 years ago and he asked her how he could thank her. He says she told him he could win an Oscar and thank her from the stage.
  
O'Connell did just that, saying he knows his mother is looking down on him.
- With Newsday.com Staff
